item.title: Estimators
item.description: Why do we need an estimator? In the previous post we discussed statistical models and the idea that a statistical model is a pair \({\left(S, \{ P_\theta \} _{\theta \in \Theta }\right)}\). We also discussed the fact that if our model is well specified then the true distribution (the one that governs reality) will be included in our selected family of distributions \(P_{\theta \in \Theta}\) for certain \(\theta\). But we did not discuss at all how we can estimate this \(\theta\).

item.title: Parametric statistical models
